Detailed Description

Class responsible for processing MCMC chains, performing diagnostics, generating plots, and managing Bayesian analysis.

This class provides utilities to handle MCMC output generated by mcmc::runMCMC. It is particularly useful for extracting values from previous MCMC runs and initiating new MCMC runs with those values. Inspired by nd280_utils/DrawComp.cpp.

See also
For more details and examples, visit the Wiki.

4023 OverallBatchMean[j] /= nBatches;
4024 }
4025

4027 #pragma omp for nowait
4028 #endif

4030 for (int j = 0; j < nDraw; ++j)

4032 for (int i = 0; i < nBatches; ++i)
4033 {
4034 (*BatchedVariance)(j) += (OverallBatchMean[j] - BatchedAverages[i][j])*(OverallBatchMean[j] - BatchedAverages[i][j]);
4035 }
4036 (*BatchedVariance)(j) = (BatchLength/(nBatches-1))* (*BatchedVariance)(j);
4037 }

4047 for (int i = 0; i < nBatches; ++i)
4048 {
4049 C_Denominator[j] += (OverallBatchMean[j] - BatchedAverages[i][j])*(OverallBatchMean[j] - BatchedAverages[i][j]);
4050 }
4051 C_Denominator[j] = 2*C_Denominator[j];
4052 }
4053

4055 #ifdef MULTITHREAD
4056 #pragma omp for
4057 #endif

4059 {
4060 for (int i = 0; i < nBatches-1; ++i)
4061 {
4062 C_Rho_Nominator[j] += (OverallBatchMean[j] - BatchedAverages[i][j])*(OverallBatchMean[j] - BatchedAverages[i+1][j]);
4063 }
4064

4067 C_Rho_Denominator[j] += (OverallBatchMean[j] - BatchedAverages[i][j])*(OverallBatchMean[j] - BatchedAverages[i][j]);
4068 }
4069 }

4073 #pragma omp for
4074 #endif

4076 {
4077 (*C_Test_Statistics)(j) = std::sqrt((nBatches*nBatches - 1)/(nBatches-2)) * ( C_Rho_Nominator[j]/C_Rho_Denominator[j] + C_Nominator[j]/ C_Denominator[j]);
4078 }
4079#ifdef MULTITHREAD
4080} //End parallel region

)
inlineprivate

KS: calc Effective Sample Size.

Parameters
nLagsShould be the same nLags as used in AutoCorrelation()
LagLValue of LagL for each dial and each Lag

This function computes the Effective Sample Size (ESS) using the autocorrelations calculated by AutoCorrelation(). Ensure that the parameter nLags here matches the number of lags used in AutoCorrelation() to obtain accurate results. [StanManual] [hanson2008mcmc] [gabry2024visual]

3828 EffectiveSampleSizeHist[i] = new TH1D(Form("EffectiveSampleSizeHist_%i",i), Form("EffectiveSampleSizeHist_%i",i), nDraw, 0, nDraw);
3829 EffectiveSampleSizeHist[i]->GetYaxis()->SetTitle("N_{eff}/N");
3830 EffectiveSampleSizeHist[i]->SetFillColor(ESSColours[i]);
3831 EffectiveSampleSizeHist[i]->SetLineColor(ESSColours[i]);
3832 EffectiveSampleSizeHist[i]->Sumw2();
3833 for (int j = 0; j < nDraw; ++j)
3834 {
3835 TString Title = "";
3836 double Prior = 1.0;
3837 double PriorError = 1.0;
3838 GetNthParameter(j, Prior, PriorError, Title);
3839 EffectiveSampleSizeHist[i]->GetXaxis()->SetBinLabel(j+1, Title.Data());
3840 }
3841 }
3842
3843 #ifdef MULTITHREAD
3844 #pragma omp parallel for
3845 #endif
3846 //KS: Calculate ESS and MCMC efficiency for each parameter
3847 for (int j = 0; j < nDraw; ++j)
3848 {
3849 (*EffectiveSampleSize)(j) = _UNDEF_;
3850 (*SamplingEfficiency)(j) = _UNDEF_;
3851 TempDenominator[j] = 0.;
3852 //KS: Firs sum over all Calculated autocorrelations
3853 for (int k = 0; k < nLags; ++k)
3854 {
3855 TempDenominator[j] += LagL[j][k];
3856 }
3857 TempDenominator[j] = 1+2*TempDenominator[j];
3858 (*EffectiveSampleSize)(j) = nEntries/TempDenominator[j];
3859 // 100 because we convert to percentage
3860 (*SamplingEfficiency)(j) = 100 * 1/TempDenominator[j];
3861
3862 for(int i = 0; i < Nhists; ++i)
3863 {
3864 EffectiveSampleSizeHist[i]->SetBinContent(j+1, 0);
3865 EffectiveSampleSizeHist[i]->SetBinError(j+1, 0);
3866
3867 const double TempEntry = std::fabs((*EffectiveSampleSize)(j)) / nEntries;
3868 if(Thresholds[i] >= TempEntry && TempEntry > Thresholds[i+1])
3869 {
3870 if( std::isnan((*EffectiveSampleSize)(j)) ) continue;
3871 EffectiveSampleSizeHist[i]->SetBinContent(j+1, TempEntry);
3872 }
3873 }
3874 }
3875
3876 //KS Write to the output tree
3877 //Save to file
3878 OutputFile->cd();
3879 EffectiveSampleSize->Write("EffectiveSampleSize");
3880 SamplingEfficiency->Write("SamplingEfficiency");
3881
3882 EffectiveSampleSizeHist[0]->SetTitle("Effective Sample Size");
3883 EffectiveSampleSizeHist[0]->Draw();
3884 for(int i = 1; i < Nhists; ++i)
3885 {
3886 EffectiveSampleSizeHist[i]->Draw("SAME");
3887 }
3888
3889 TLegend *leg = new TLegend(0.2, 0.7, 0.6, 0.95);
3890 leg->SetTextSize(0.03);
3891 for(int i = 0; i < Nhists; ++i)
3892 {
3893 leg->AddEntry(EffectiveSampleSizeHist[i], Form("%.4f >= N_{eff}/N > %.4f", Thresholds[i], Thresholds[i+1]), "f");
3894 }
3895 leg->SetLineColor(0);
3896 leg->SetLineStyle(0);
3897 leg->SetFillColor(0);
3898 leg->SetFillStyle(0);
3899 leg->Draw("SAME");
3900
3901 Posterior->Write("EffectiveSampleSizeCanvas");

3904 delete EffectiveSampleSize;
3905 delete SamplingEfficiency;

Calculate Bayes factor for vector of params, and model boundaries.

Parameters

Model2BoundsLower and upper bound for hypothesis 2. Within this bound we calculate integral used later for Bayes Factor

3000 if(Bounds[k][0] > Bounds[k][1])
3001 {
3002 MACH3LOG_ERROR("Lower bound is higher than upper bound");
3003 throw MaCh3Exception(__FILE__ , __LINE__ );
3004 }
3005 PriorHist = new TH1D("PriorHist", Title, NBins, Bounds[k][0], Bounds[k][1]);
3006
3007 double FlatProb = ( Bounds[k][1] - Bounds[k][0]) / NBins;
3008 for (int g = 0; g < NBins + 1; ++g)
3009 {
3010 PriorHist->SetBinContent(g+1, FlatProb);
3011 }
3012 }
3013 else //KS: Otherwise throw from Gaussian
3014 {
3015 PriorHist = (TH1D*) PosteriorHist->Clone("Prior");
3016 PriorHist->Reset("");
3017 PriorHist->Fill(0.0, 0.0);
3018
3019 TRandom3* rand = new TRandom3(0);
3020 //KS: Throw nice gaussian, just need big number to have smooth distribution
3021 for(int g = 0; g < 1000000; ++g)
3022 {
3023 PriorHist->Fill(rand->Gaus(Prior, PriorError));
3024 }
3025 delete rand;
3026 }
3027 // Area normalise the distributions
3028 PriorHist->Scale(1./PriorHist->Integral(), "width");
3029 PosteriorHist->Scale(1./PosteriorHist->Integral(), "width");
3030
3031 PriorHist->SetLineColor(kRed);
3032 PriorHist->SetMarkerColor(kRed);
3033 PriorHist->SetFillColorAlpha(kRed, 0.35);
3034 PriorHist->SetFillStyle(1001);
3035 PriorHist->GetXaxis()->SetTitle(Title);
3036 PriorHist->GetYaxis()->SetTitle("Posterior Probability");
3037 PriorHist->SetMaximum(PosteriorHist->GetMaximum()*1.5);
3038 PriorHist->GetYaxis()->SetLabelOffset(999);
3039 PriorHist->GetYaxis()->SetLabelSize(0);
3040 PriorHist->SetLineWidth(2);
3041 PriorHist->SetLineStyle(kSolid);
3042
3043 PosteriorHist->SetLineColor(kBlue);
3044 PosteriorHist->SetMarkerColor(kBlue);
3045 PosteriorHist->SetFillColorAlpha(kBlue, 0.35);
3046 PosteriorHist->SetFillStyle(1001);
3047
3048 PriorHist->Draw("hist");
3049 PosteriorHist->Draw("hist same");
3050
3051 double ProbPrior = PriorHist->GetBinContent(PriorHist->FindBin(EvaluationPoint[k]));
3052 //KS: In case we go so far away that prior is 0, set this to small value to avoid dividing by 0
3053 if(ProbPrior < 0) ProbPrior = 0.00001;
3054 double ProbPosterior = PosteriorHist->GetBinContent(PosteriorHist->FindBin(EvaluationPoint[k]));
3055 double SavageDickey = ProbPosterior/ProbPrior;
3056
3057 std::string DunneKabothScale = GetDunneKaboth(SavageDickey);

3059 TGraph *PostPoint = new TGraph(1);
3060 PostPoint->SetPoint(0, EvaluationPoint[k], ProbPosterior);
3061 PostPoint->SetMarkerStyle(20);
3062 PostPoint->SetMarkerSize(1);
3063 PostPoint->Draw("P same");
3064
3065 TGraph *PriorPoint = new TGraph(1);
3066 PriorPoint->SetPoint(0, EvaluationPoint[k], ProbPrior);
3067 PriorPoint->SetMarkerStyle(20);
3068 PriorPoint->SetMarkerSize(1);
3069 PriorPoint->Draw("P same");
3070
3071 TLegend *legend = new TLegend(0.12, 0.6, 0.6, 0.97);
3072 legend->SetTextSize(0.04);
3073 legend->AddEntry(PriorHist, "Prior", "l");
3074 legend->AddEntry(PosteriorHist, "Posterior", "l");
3075 legend->AddEntry(PostPoint, Form("SavageDickey = %.2f, (%s)", SavageDickey, DunneKabothScale.c_str()),"");
3076 legend->SetLineColor(0);
3077 legend->SetLineStyle(0);
3078 legend->SetFillColor(0);
3079 legend->SetFillStyle(0);
3080 legend->SetBorderSize(0);
3081 legend->Draw("same");
3082
3083 Posterior->Print(CanvasName);
3084 Posterior->Write(Title);
3085
3086 delete PosteriorHist;
3087 delete PriorHist;
3088 delete PostPoint;
3089 delete PriorPoint;
3090 delete legend;
3091 } //End loop over parameters
3092
3093 SavageDickeyDir->Close();
3094 delete SavageDickeyDir;
3095
3096 OutputFile->cd();

Geweke Diagnostic based on the methods described by Fang (2014) and Karlsbakk (2011). [Fang2014GewekeDiagnostics] [karlsbakk2011].

4229 {
4230// **************************
4231 MACH3LOG_INFO("Making Geweke Diagnostic");
4232
4233 //KS: Up refers to upper limit we check, it stays constant, in literature it is mostly 50% thus using 0.5 for threshold
4234 double* MeanUp = new double[nDraw]();
4235 double* SpectralVarianceUp = new double[nDraw]();
4236 int* DenomCounterUp = new int[nDraw]();
4237 const double Threshold = 0.5 * nSteps;
4238
4239 //KS: Select values betwen which you want to scan, for example 0 means 0% burn in and 1 100% burn in.
4240 const double LowerThreshold = 0;
4241 const double UpperThreshold = 1.0;
4242 // Tells how many intervals between thresholds we want to check
4243 const int NChecks = 100;
4244 const double Division = (UpperThreshold - LowerThreshold)/NChecks;
4245
4246 TH1D** GewekePlots = new TH1D*[nDraw];
4247 for (int j = 0; j < nDraw; ++j)
4248 {
4249 MeanUp[j] = 0;
4250 SpectralVarianceUp[j] = 0;
4251 DenomCounterUp[j] = 0;
4252
4253 TString Title = "";
4254 double Prior = 1.0;
4255 double PriorError = 1.0;
4256 GetNthParameter(j, Prior, PriorError, Title);
4257 std::string HistName = Form("%s_%s_Geweke", Title.Data(), BranchNames[j].Data());
4258 GewekePlots[j] = new TH1D(HistName.c_str(), HistName.c_str(), NChecks, 0.0, 100*UpperThreshold);
4259 GewekePlots[j]->GetXaxis()->SetTitle("Burn-In (%)");
4260 GewekePlots[j]->GetYaxis()->SetTitle("Geweke T score");
4261 }
4262
4263//KS: Start parallel region
4264#ifdef MULTITHREAD
4265#pragma omp parallel
4266{
4267#endif
4268 //KS: First we calculate mean and spectral variance for the upper limit, this doesn't change and in literature is most often 50%
4269 #ifdef MULTITHREAD
4270 #pragma omp for
4271 #endif
4272 for (int j = 0; j < nDraw; ++j)
4273 {
4274 for(int i = 0; i < nEntries; ++i)
4275 {
4276 if(StepNumber[i] > Threshold)
4277 {
4278 MeanUp[j] += ParStep[j][i];
4279 DenomCounterUp[j]++;
4280 }
4281 }
4282 MeanUp[j] = MeanUp[j]/DenomCounterUp[j];
4283 }
4284
4285 //KS: now Spectral variance which in this case is sample variance
4286 #ifdef MULTITHREAD
4287 #pragma omp for collapse(2)
4288 #endif
4289 for (int j = 0; j < nDraw; ++j)
4290 {
4291 for(int i = 0; i < nEntries; ++i)
4292 {
4293 if(StepNumber[i] > Threshold)
4294 {
4295 SpectralVarianceUp[j] += (ParStep[j][i] - MeanUp[j])*(ParStep[j][i] - MeanUp[j]);
4296 }
4297 }
4298 }
4299
4300 //Loop over how many intervals we calculate
4301 #ifdef MULTITHREAD
4302 #pragma omp for
4303 #endif
4304 for (int k = 1; k < NChecks+1; ++k)
4305 {
4306 //KS each thread has it's own
4307 double* MeanDown = new double[nDraw]();
4308 double* SpectralVarianceDown = new double[nDraw]();
4309 int* DenomCounterDown = new int[nDraw]();
4310
4311 //set to 0
4312 for (int j = 0; j < nDraw; ++j)
4313 {
4314 MeanDown[j] = 0;
4315 SpectralVarianceDown[j] = 0;
4316 DenomCounterDown[j] = 0;
4317 }
4318
4319 const int ThresholsCheck = Division*k*nSteps;
4320 //KS: First mean
4321 for (int j = 0; j < nDraw; ++j)
4322 {
4323 for(int i = 0; i < nEntries; ++i)
4324 {
4325 if(StepNumber[i] < ThresholsCheck)
4326 {
4327 MeanDown[j] += ParStep[j][i];
4328 DenomCounterDown[j]++;
4329 }
4330 }
4331 MeanDown[j] = MeanDown[j]/DenomCounterDown[j];
4332 }
4333
4334 //Now spectral variance
4335 for (int j = 0; j < nDraw; ++j)
4336 {
4337 for(int i = 0; i < nEntries; ++i)
4338 {
4339 if(StepNumber[i] < ThresholsCheck)
4340 {
4341 SpectralVarianceDown[j] += (ParStep[j][i] - MeanDown[j])*(ParStep[j][i] - MeanDown[j]);
4342 }
4343 }
4344 }
4345 //Lastly calc T score and fill histogram entry
4346 for (int j = 0; j < nDraw; ++j)
4347 {
4348 double T_score = std::fabs((MeanDown[j] - MeanUp[j])/std::sqrt(SpectralVarianceDown[j]/DenomCounterDown[j] + SpectralVarianceUp[j]/DenomCounterUp[j]));
4349
4350 GewekePlots[j]->SetBinContent(k, T_score);
4351 }
4352 //KS: delete for each thread
4353 delete[] MeanDown;
4354 delete[] SpectralVarianceDown;
4355 delete[] DenomCounterDown;
4356 } //end loop over intervals
4357#ifdef MULTITHREAD
4358} //End parallel region
4359#endif
4360
4361 //Finally save it to TFile
4362 OutputFile->cd();
4363 TDirectory *GewekeDir = OutputFile->mkdir("Geweke");
4364 for (int j = 0; j < nDraw; ++j)
4365 {
4366 GewekeDir->cd();
4367 GewekePlots[j]->Write();
4368 delete GewekePlots[j];
4369 }
4370 delete[] GewekePlots;
4371
4372 //Free memory
4373 delete[] MeanUp;
4374 delete[] DenomCounterUp;
4375 delete[] SpectralVarianceUp;
4376
4377 for (int i = 0; i < nDraw; ++i) {
4378 delete[] ParStep[i];
4379 }
4380 delete[] ParStep;
4381
4382 GewekeDir->Close();
4383 delete GewekeDir;
4384
4385 OutputFile->cd();
4386}

1363 clock.Start();
1364
1365 TH1D* SubOptimality = new TH1D("Suboptimality", "Suboptimality", NIntervals, MinStep, MaxStep);
1366 SubOptimality->GetXaxis()->SetTitle("Step");
1367 SubOptimality->GetYaxis()->SetTitle("Suboptimality");
1368 SubOptimality->SetLineWidth(2);
1369 SubOptimality->SetLineColor(kBlue);
1370
1371 for(int i = 0; i < NIntervals; ++i)
1372 {
1373 //Reset our cov matrix
1374 ResetHistograms();
1375
1376 //Set threshold for calculating new matrix
1377 UpperCut = i*IntervalsSize;
1378 //Calculate cov matrix
1379 MakeCovariance_MP(true);
1380
1381 //Calculate eigen values
1382 TMatrixDSymEigen eigen(*Covariance);
1383 TVectorD eigen_values;
1384 eigen_values.ResizeTo(eigen.GetEigenValues());
1385 eigen_values = eigen.GetEigenValues();
1386
1387 //KS: Converting from ROOT to vector as to make using other libraires (Eigen) easier in future
1388 std::vector<double> EigenValues(eigen_values.GetNrows());
1389 for(unsigned int j = 0; j < EigenValues.size(); j++)
1390 {
1391 EigenValues[j] = eigen_values(j);
1392 }
1393 const double SubOptimalityValue = GetSubOptimality(EigenValues, nDraw);
1394 SubOptimality->SetBinContent(i+1, SubOptimalityValue);
1395 }
1396 clock.Stop();
1397 MACH3LOG_INFO("Making Suboptimality took {:.2f}s to finish for {} steps", clock.RealTime(), nEntries);
1398
1399 UpperCut = DefaultUpperCut;
1400 BurnInCut = DefaultBurnInCut;
1401 printToPDF = defaultPrintToPDF;
1402
1403 SubOptimality->Draw("l");
1404 Posterior->SetName(SubOptimality->GetName());
1405 Posterior->SetTitle(SubOptimality->GetTitle());
1406
1407 if(printToPDF) Posterior->Print(CanvasName);
1408 // Write it to root file
1409 OutputFile->cd();
1410 Posterior->Write();
1411
1412 delete SubOptimality;
1413}

)

Make fancy triangle plot for selected parameters.

Parameters
CredibleIntervalsVector with values of credible intervals, must be in descending order
CredibleIntervalsColoursColor_t telling what colour to use for each Interval line
CredibleInSigmasBool telling whether intervals are in percentage or in sigmas, then special conversions is used
CredibleRegionsVector with values of credible intervals, must be in descending order
CredibleRegionStyleStyle_t telling what line style to use for each Interval line
CredibleRegionColorColor_t telling what colour to use for each Interval line
CredibleInSigmasBool telling whether intervals are in percentage or in sigmas, then special conversions is used

Scale the histograms so it shows the posterior probability
